page.title: 04 Crops on Furzen Farm
page.content: Furzen Farm is part of the Addington Estate.There are 1032 acres split up as follows: 350 acres of grass;400 acres of winter wheat;100 acres ofwinter barley;100 acres of winter oats;50 acres of beans and 32 acres of roads, woodland and farmbuildings. The farmer told us a saying which helps us recognise the different crops. Wheat has whiskers,barley has a beard, oats are out (because they are easy to recognise). The grass is cut in Summer to make both silage and hay.Silege is stored under plastic sheeting with tyres on top to hold it down and keep the air out.Hay is carefully dried,baled and stacked in a barn.Hay is fed to the animals in Winter. Barley and oats are sold as cash crops.Straw from the corn is kept as bedding for the stock in Winter.
